children.text: Okay, I need to translate these three Java programs into a single Fortran program that works the same way when run in sequence.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: Let me start by understanding each Java program's purpose and how they interact.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: First, the first Java file (atcoder_ABC129_E) reads a string from input, processes it with some dynamic programming, and outputs a number modulo 1e9+7.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: The second file (atcoder_ABC136_B) takes an integer N, calculates some count based on its digits, and outputs that.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: The third (codeforces_669_A) takes an integer n and outputs (n//3)*2 plus 1 if there's a remainder, else 0. But since they are run in sequence, the output of the first is the input to the second, and the second's output is the input to the third. So the overall process is: input -> first program's output -> second's input -> second's output -> third's input -> third's output.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text: Now, let's break down each Java program's logic into Fortran code.

children.text:
Putting all together, the Fortran code would be:

program main

  implicit none

  integer, parameter :: M = 1000000007

  character(len=100000) :: s

  integer :: n, i, current_char_code, result_first, N, count, temp, ans, final_result

  integer, allocatable :: dp(:,:)

  ! Read input string

  read(*,'(A)') s

  n = len_trim(s)

  allocate(dp(0:n, 0:1))

  dp = 0

  dp(0,0) = 1

  do i = 1, n

     if (s(i:i) == '0') then

        dp(i,0) = dp(i-1,0)

        dp(i,1) = dp(i-1,1)

     else

        dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i-1,0) + dp(i-1,1), M)

     end if

     ! Second part of the first program's logic

     if (s(i:i) == '0') then

        dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i,1) + mod(2 * dp(i-1,1), M), M)

     else

        dp(i,0) = mod(dp(i,0) + mod(2 * dp(i-1,0), M), M)

        dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i,1) + mod(2 * dp(i-1,1), M), M)

     end if

  end do

  result_first = mod(dp(n,0) + dp(n,1), M)

  ! Second program's logic

  N = result_first

  count = 0

  temp = N

  do while (temp > 0)

     count = count +1

     temp = temp /10

  end do

  ans = 0

  do i =1, count

     if (i == count) then

        if (mod(i,2) ==1) then

           ans = ans + (N - 10**(i-1) +1)

        end if

     else

        if (i ==1) then

           ans = ans +9

program main

  implicit none

  integer, parameter :: M = 1000000007

  character(len=100000) :: s

  integer :: n, i, current_char_code, result_first, N, count, temp, ans, final_result

  integer, allocatable :: dp(:,:)

  ! Read input string

  n = len_trim(s)

  allocate(dp(0:n, 0:1))

  dp = 0

  dp(0,0) = 1

  do i = 1, n

     if (s(i:i) == '0') then

        dp(i,0) = dp(i-1,0)

        dp(i,1) = dp(i-1,1)

     else

        dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i-1,0) + dp(i-1,1), M)

     end if

     ! Second part of the first program's logic

        dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i,1) + mod(2 * dp(i-1,1), M), M)

        dp(i,0) = mod(dp(i,0) + mod(2 * dp(i-1,0), M), M)

        dp(i,1) = mod(dp(i,1) + mod(2 * dp(i-1,1), M), M)

     end if

  end do

  result_first = mod(dp(n,0) + dp(n,1), M)

  ! Second program's logic

  N = result_first

  count = 0

  temp = N

  do while (temp > 0)

     count = count +1

     temp = temp /10

  end do

  ans = 0

  do i =1, count

     if (i == count) then

        if (mod(i,2) ==1) then

           ans = ans + (N - 10**(i-1) +1)

        end if

     else

           ans = ans +9

        else if (mod(i,2) ==1) then

           ans = ans + (10**i - 10**(i-1))

        end if

     end if

  end do

  ! Third program's logic

  final_result = (ans /3)*2 + merge(1,0, mod(ans,3)/=0)

  print*, final_result

  deallocate(dp)

end program main
